original_title: Sanitary napkins for Sri Lanka school girls next year: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – From next year school girls above Grade 6 in the country will be provided with free sanitary napkins, education minister Susil Premajayantha said in parliament on Monday (27).

“There are 24 lakhs of schoolchildren above Grade 6 in our country. Half of them are girls. We hope to cover at least 10 of the 12 lakhs, excluding the main schools,” Premajayantha said in response to a question by Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) parliamentarian Hesha Withanage and clarification by state minister of women and child affairs Geetha Kumarasinghe.
“From next year, through a CSR project we’ve discussed, we hope to start with at least 300,000 and increase gradually.”
“We will prioritise regional schools with a focus on poorer and remote ones. If we get government funds, we will be able to provide coverage to all school girls in the country.”
Providing free sanitary napkins was an election campaign promise of present opposition leader Sajith Premadasa of the SJB.
Sri Lanka firm launches low-cost sanitary napkins for schoolgirls in currency crisis
Outside urban areas, schoolgirls still stay away from school when they get their periods due to the high cost of sanitary napkins. (Colombo/Nov27/2023)
